teams.name: Intel Small Things Challenge
teams.loan_because: Every small, individual action can make a big difference -- especially if millions participate. A modest micro-loan will give an entrepreneur a hand-up to start a new business and provide for his or her family.
teams.description:
Intel is the corporate sponsor of the Small Things Challenge. The company is providing financial support as well as providing opportunities throughout the year to increase global awareness for the issues addressed by the Small Things Challenge – providing opportunities so children in developing countries can attend primary school and their parents can earn higher incomes.
The Intel Small Things Challenge builds upon Intel’s 40 years of active involvement in education. The company is again investing about $100 million in education in 2009. Over the last decade, Intel has invested over $1 billion and Intel employees have donated more than 2 million hours towards improving education in 50 countries.  
Individuals can provide support and find more information about the Small Things Challenge – including the online petition and a video featuring musicians and actors who support the cause – at www.smallthingschallenge.com.

teams.name: Czech Team
teams.loan_because: People around the world helped us in the past, so we should repay.

teams.name: wildones
teams.loan_because:
Life is too short to not do something worthwhile with $25. It's easy to blow $25 on a bottle of wine, or a movie (for one), or 5 caramel-skinny-hot-foam-almond-decaf lattes... but that doesn't do ANYONE any good.

By taking that $25 - which by our north american standards doesn't seem like a lot - and turning it into a possibly life-changing opportunity for someone for whom $25 is an impossible amount... that $25 gets life, and gives inspiration, and lifts someone up just that little bit more.
teams.description: A mish-mash of friends, family, colleagues, clients & strangers who have someone connected along a common path to attempt to do some good...

teams.name: Australia
teams.loan_because:
Australians all let us rejoice
for we are young and free,    -   
We've heard the call of nations wide,
How can we let this be?    -   
We'll share our wealth,
We'll make the change,
We'll help to set them free   -   
From us to them
and back again, 
As one we all shall be      - 

(Thanks to member Jean for this one)

Find us on Facebook at http://www.facebook.com/group.php?gid=97953452142

teams.name: Knights of Columbus
teams.loan_because: Many threads make up a rope.  We are Catholic Brothers bound together by Charity, Unity, Fraternalism and Patriotism.
teams.description:
Learn About Us 
Visit Our 125th Anniversary Web Site

Thanks to the efforts of Father Michael J. McGivney, assistant pastor of St. Mary’s Church in New Haven and some of his parishioners, the Connecticut state legislature on March 29, 1882, officially chartered the Knights of Columbus as a fraternal benefit society. The Order is still true to its founding principles of charity, unity and fraternity.

The Knights was formed to render financial aid to members and their families. Mutual aid and assistance are offered to sick, disabled and needy members and their families. Social and intellectual fellowship is promoted among members and their families through educational, charitable, religious, social welfare, war relief and public relief works.

The history of the Order shows how the foresight of Father Michael J. McGivney, whose cause for sainthood is being investigated by the Vatican, brought about what has become the world's foremost Catholic fraternal benefit society. The Order has helped families obtain economic security and stability through its life insurance, annuity and long-term care programs, and has contributed time and energy worldwide to service in communities.

The Knights of Columbus has grown from several members in one council to more than 13,000 councils and 1.7 million members throughout the United States, Canada, the Philippines, Mexico, Poland, the Dominican Republic, Puerto Rico, Panama, the Bahamas, the Virgin Islands, Cuba, Guatemala, Guam and Saipan.

teams.name: España - Spain
teams.loan_because: Kiva ofrece un medio ideal para participar activamente en el apoyo a emprendedores sin recursos que no pueden acceder a los canales normales de financiación y que, gracias a los micro-créditos, pueden  desarrollar una actividad empresarial que les permita, a ellos y su entorno, alcanzar una mejor calidad de vida.
teams.description:
Este club se creó con la intención inicial de fomentar la participación de españolas y españoles en Kiva, no obstante,  está abierto a todas las personas que deseen unirse a él, sin importar su nacionalidad ni ninguna otra condición.
 
El único referente identitario de este grupo es la solidaridad y la convicción de que, a través de Kiva, es posible el apoyo a personas o grupos emprendedores que buscan y merecen una oportunidad por su esfuerzo.

teams.name: Mars Hill Lending Team
teams.description:
From 2007 to 2012, the Mars Hill community invested $1.2 million dollars to support the efforts of Turame Community Finance in Burundi, Africa. Now we are continuing our involvement with Turame in an even more hands-on-way - by becoming microfinance lenders. 

How to get involved:
1. Click the join team button to the left [if you are new to Kiva you will need to create an account].

2. Choose a Borrower: Check out the current Turame loans by scrolling down at this link: [http://bit.ly/pGU0sd] If there are no new loans, check back in as Turame posts new loans twice a month.

3. Make a Loan:

4. Get Repaid: Over the course of 6 months your loan will get repaid to you in the form of Kiva credit. [This is a loan, not a donation]

5. Repeat.  You can take the money and put it back in your pocket or make a loan to another group.

Thanks for helping support Turame Community Finance in providing loans to those living in one of the poorest countries on the planet. 
You can learn more about Turame here: www.kiva.org/partners/162

teams.name: University of Pennsylvania
teams.loan_because: we are Quakers!
teams.description: "I do not pretend to give such a Sum; I only lend it to you. When you meet with another honest Man in similar Distress, you must pay me by lending this Sum to him; enjoining him to discharge the Debt by a like operation, when he shall be able, and shall meet with another opportunity. I hope it may thus go thro' many hands, before it meets with a Knave that will stop its Progress. This is a trick of mine for doing a deal of good with a little money." ....i.e. Pay it Forward.  -- Ben Franklin, in a letter to Benjamin Webb dated April 22, 1784

We believe in:
**The inherent worth and dignity of every person
**Justice, equity and compassion in human relations
**Acceptance of one another and encouragement to spiritual growth in our congregations
**A free and responsible search for truth and meaning
**The right of conscience and the use of the democratic process within our congregations and in society at large
**The goal of world community with peace, liberty, and justice for all
**Respect for the interdependent web of all existence of which we are a part.
teams.description:

For more information on us, or to find a congregation near you, check out the main website for the Unitarian Universalist Association

We promote Kiva.org as a sustainable and transparent way of connecting lenders and borrowers from across the globe. We love India - therefore we are the Kiva Team India. We love to use the Kiva concept to provide loans in India ! http://www.kiva.org/india

Funding loans from India: http://www.kiva.org/lend?countries=IN

teams.name: Friends of Bob Harris
teams.loan_because:
After stumbling into a job as a luxury travel writer, I saw so much poverty that I decided to turn those paychecks into Kiva loans. Then I visited a bunch of clients, who were amazing, and I've written a book about it called "The International Bank of Bob" (Walker/Bloomsbury, March 5, 2013).

I hope the book will get more people to feel a greater understanding of Kiva, a better appreciation of the role of microfinance, and most of all, more connected to the rest of the world.
teams.description: People who realize that if we switched places with the recipients, they'd loan to us just as happily.  So, fair's fair.

teams.name: Australia
teams.loan_because:
Australians all let us rejoice
for we are young and free,    -   
We've heard the call of nations wide,
How can we let this be?    -   
We'll share our wealth,
We'll make the change,
We'll help to set them free   -   
From us to them
and back again, 
As one we all shall be      - 

(Thanks to member Jean for this one)

Find us on Facebook at http://www.facebook.com/group.php?gid=97953452142
teams.description: Kiva Loaners in Australia

teams.description: We are students, staff and faculty and friends of a Christian university in western Canada.

teams.name: Team CANADA
teams.loan_because:
So little means so much. And because we are so fortunate to be able to lend with the luxury of not worrying about whether we ever see that money again, while the clients borrow with the hope and determination that they will be able to repay, and improve their lives along the way.

Check out fundraising loans already being supported by Team Canada:
http://www.kiva.org/team/team_canada/loans?status=fundRaising

teams.name: Business Performance
teams.loan_because: every day we help people become more profitable in their business. However, all too many people do not have the opportunity to improve their lives easily. We greatly admire the entrepreneurial spirit; those courageous people who want to give it a go and create a better world for themselves and their family. We want to help you make the most of that desire for a better life.
teams.description: Our company is based in Melbourne, Australia and serves an international client and customer base. We proudly supply business and management coaching services. In addition, we create and distribute a variety of software tools and guides designed to help business owners, managers and practitioners be more effective. We are passionate about developing people and helping businesses grow.

teams.name: Kiva Muslims
teams.loan_because:
002.271 Yusuf Ali Translation:
If ye disclose (acts of) charity, even so it is well, but if ye conceal them, and make them reach those (really) in need, that is best for you: It will remove from you some of your (stains of) evil. And Allah is well acquainted with what ye do.
teams.description: Insha'Allah our team will be a collaboration of people from all walks of life united by one goal: to help those less fortunate and displaying great appreciation to our creator for blessing us to help make a differerence in the world.

teams.name: Norway
teams.loan_because:
We have Cold Weather - Warm hearts !
We believe that providing microloans to entrepreneurs in developing countries is the socially responsive way of helping people break the circle of poverty. 

We promote Kiva.org as a sustainable and transparent way of connecting lenders and borrowers from across the globe.
teams.description:
Bruk denne linken for å invitere dine venner til teamet her:
http://www.kiva.org/team/norway/recruit

Det er flott hvis du trykker Facebook "anbefale/recommend" knappen oppe til høyre  på denne siden. Vår facebookgruppe: http://www.facebook.com/pages/Kiva-Norway/193432017389484

Anbefalte lån "sikrere" lån: 
http://www.kiva.org/lend?sortBy=partner_default_min=0&partner_default_max=0.5&partner_risk_rating_min=1&partner_risk_rating_max=5&partner_arrears_min=0&partner_arrears_max=1.1&sortBy=repaymentTerm
Hjelp med "expiring loans": http://poverty2prosperity.org/sosloans/#fundraising_loans

Hjelp med "postdisbursed" lån:
http://kivatools.com/fundraising/postdisbursedloans

Kiva tools:
https://www.kiva.org/portfolio/collections
http://www.bhodisoft.com/kiva-country-collector/
http://www.bhodisoft.com/kfpc/
http://www.kivalens.org

Da har vi nådd målet på 2 million dollar utlånt. Takk til alle som har bidratt!

teams.name: Microfinance Society (Singapore)
teams.loan_because: We are the Microfinance society of Singapore, and we want to loan to borrowers in Asia.
teams.description:
The Microfinance Society (Singapore) was officially set up on 29 September
2009 in Singapore. Our mission is to connect, educate and engage people in
the field of microfinance by creating a forum for innovation and
collaboration, thereby reducing global poverty. We strive to bring people
together who are interested in learning about microfinance, micro-credit,
and related finance, economic, and development topics.

Our objectives are - to provide opportunities to learn about microfinance by
broadening outreach and deepening knowledge, to create connections/contacts
between individuals interested in microfinance, to better share microfinance
information and related opportunities and help individuals involved in
microfinance-related projects, to support MFI-initiatives.

For more information, please visit http://www.microfinance.org.sg

teams.name: KIVA Lenders from Singapore Team
teams.loan_because: Our Little Contribution Can Change The Way Some People Live...This is NOT Charity, so we are not handicapping anyone by giving them freebies, we are merely coming forward to HELP.
teams.description: We are a bunch of people from all walks of life in Singapore, sharing the same dream, the same goal, the same passion and the same desire - To Help Others Stand On Their Feet.

teams.name: Singapore
teams.loan_because: every effort matters, every offered hand deserves another, and any contribution counts.
teams.description: Our efforts might be small but they're a big difference to someone else, and ever so worth it.

We ought to.

We can.

We think you should too.
teams.description:

If each person who is able, saves one person, then the world is already saved---Karl Haddad.

are but a witness --- Khalil Gibran

teams.name: Poverty2Prosperity.org - Poverty-Escape
teams.loan_because: Poverty2Prosperity.org (P2P) is all about Poverty-Escape. Please join our fun team and put Poverty-Escape in the lead!  See how to get your I'm a Kiva Loaner Bracelet and more by participating on Team P2P - visit our web site for details!
teams.description:
One of P2P's major poverty-escaping projects is to participate in making microloans through the Kiva platform. See the web site for details on all of our projects. Also see our Perpetual Fund lender account which allows people to designate funds for perpetual loaning here on Kiva, http://www.kiva.org/lender/P2PPerpetualFund

We have a special purpose fund to keep loans from expiring. Please join us at http://poverty2prosperity.org/sosloans to see currently funding loans from the SOS Loan fund.

NOTE:  Poverty2Prosperity is also a non-profit, and any messages not related to Kiva or Poverty2Prosperity may be deleted.  If there is an idea you would like to share, contact one of the Team Captains to get permission.  Thank you for your consideration.

teams.name: Indonesian Veterinary Training Program
teams.whereabouts: Woodland Park Zoo, Seattle, Washington, USA
teams.loan_because:
We are connecting responsible science to social commitment. Our process builds sustainability through delivering practical scientific information to those who live and work in some of the world's most biodiverse areas. IVTP builds trust through networking and communication to establish sustainability for wildlife and their habitats and viable livelihoods for communities in remote areas of Southeast Asia.

We believe measurable success comes from integrating scientific knowledge with an understanding of cultural sensitivity and a commitment to societal expectations. Working together, we make our world healthier.
teams.description:
We connect borrowers to Indonesian veterinarians through kiva.org. 
Our Vision: Global health initiatives require integrating animal, human and environmental health concerns at the community level.

The International Wildlife Veterinary Training Program (IVTP) focuses its work in Indonesia and combines the unique strengths of animal health programs from the Woodland Park Zoo with the Indonesian Veterinary Medical Association (IVMA). Our goal is to enhance environmental management and leadership capacity in the tropics for healthy wildlife. Integrating basic medical care with environmental protection strategies focused in Southeast Asia, IVTP offers cutting-edge training and networking opportunities to support human and animal health, sustainable biodiversity and community welfare.

teams.loan_because: We want to start off our lives together giving back in a way that is meaningful to us!

teams.loan_because: We care about human beings and understand that it takes people to help people.
teams.description:
We are one human family, and we know that people can do good without believing in a god.

The Plus sign in the A+ Team logo reflects the fact that the team comprises Atheists, PLUS Agnostics, Skeptics, Freethinkers, Secular Humanists, and Non-Religious members.  A+ is also a symbol of excellence.

***TEAM WEBSITE***
http://apluskiva.wordpress.com/

***TEAM RESOURCES***
Secular Loans
http://goo.gl/wtDkJ

Field Partners - Social and Secular Ratings:
www.tinyurl.com/AASFSHNR-MFIs

***OTHER RESOURCES:***
Starfish List:
http://starfish.dynalias.org/

KivaLens:
http://www.kivalens.org/

Toolkit for analyzing Kiva data:
http://build.kiva.org/

teams.name: women empowering women
teams.loan_because: empower a woman, change the world.

teams.name: Singapore
teams.loan_because: every effort matters, every offered hand deserves another, and any contribution counts.
teams.description: Our efforts might be small but they're a big difference to someone else, and ever so worth it.

teams.name: The University of Virginia (UVa)
teams.loan_because: We believe in Kiva's mission, and the value of educating people all over the world about the potential for economic growth through micro-finance.
teams.description: We are a group of diverse young people who attend the University of Virginia, with backgrounds from all over the world, who share a similar interest in micro-finance and related issues.

teams.name: Team Obama
teams.loan_because: We understand that our combined efforts through Kiva will help make this world a much better place!
teams.description: http://www.npr.org/templates/story/story.php?storyId=127545645

teams.name: The Gamblin Family and Friends
teams.loan_because: Steve got us started

teams.name: Florida Gators for Kiva
teams.loan_because: The Gator Nation is everywhere, so by loaning money to people worldwide, we expand the reach of the Gator Nation.
teams.description: The Florida Gators are students and alumni from the University of Florida.

teams.name: The Gundersens
teams.loan_because: It's a way to give back

teams.name: Team CANADA
teams.loan_because:
So little means so much. And because we are so fortunate to be able to lend with the luxury of not worrying about whether we ever see that money again, while the clients borrow with the hope and determination that they will be able to repay, and improve their lives along the way.

Check out fundraising loans already being supported by Team Canada:
http://www.kiva.org/team/team_canada/loans?status=fundRaising
teams.description: We're Canadian, eh?

teams.name: Edmonton Alberta
teams.loan_because:
We live in the best country in the world and Kiva represents the entrepreneurial spirit that created it.
It is the "pay it forward" ideology!
teams.description: Edmontonians who want to make a difference at a grass roots level and feel that government and big organisations cannot and will not do enough.

teams.name: Crazy Canucks
teams.loan_because: We live in a well-to-do nation and want to help those less fortunate than ourselves
teams.description: We are CANADIAN !!!

teams.name: Hedberg and friends
teams.loan_because: we care.
teams.description: Family and friends.

teams.name: Church of the Flying Spaghetti Monster
teams.loan_because:
"Thou shalt share, that none may seek without funding."   A nod to VII.  of “RANDOM NUMBER OF NOT COMMANDMENTS, SUGGESTIONS"  in the LOOSE CANON:
http://www.loose-canon.info/page17.htm
teams.description:
Members of the Church of the Flying Spaghetti Monster  

Secular vs religious Field Partners, see links at http://atheist-monkey.blogspot.de/2009/08/kiva-mfi-checker.html

For Kiva tips and who knows what the FSM will move us to add for mutual benefit & merriment:  
http://flyingspaghettikivans.blogspot.it/    

and
  https://www.facebook.com/pages/FlyingSpaghettiKivans

teams.name: Scotland
teams.loan_because: Scotland has always been a place where inventors have prospered and philanthropy has flourished. This is a chance to show that Scots do care and can make a difference in the world.
teams.description: It's a team for anyone who has links to Scotland, either through birth, marriage or simply location.

teams.name: Stuff You Should Know from HowStuffWorks.com
teams.loan_because: We care.
teams.description: Arguably the finest assemblage of people who have never met dedicated to the common purpose of hastening global peace in $25 increments.

teams.name: HALF THE SKY: Empowering Women
teams.loan_because: we believe empowering women is the key to alleviating social injustice and achieving world stability.
teams.description:
Inspired by the book HALF THE SKY written by Nicholas Kristof and Sheryl WuDunn, our team is committed to helping curb culturally accepted abuse of women around the world.

Facebook page: http://www.facebook.com/HALFTHESKYEmpoweringWomenKIVATeam

teams.name: The Sandersons
teams.whereabouts: South Dakota and wherever we may wander

teams.name: India
teams.loan_because: "What we should aim at is the creation of people power, which is opposed to the power of violence and is different from the coercive power of state." - Vinoba Bhave
teams.description:
We believe that providing microloans to entrepreneurs in developing countries is the socially responsive way of helping people break the circle of poverty.

We promote Kiva.org as a sustainable and transparent way of connecting lenders and borrowers from across the globe. We love India - therefore we are the Kiva Team India. We love to use the Kiva concept to provide loans in India ! http://www.kiva.org/india

Funding loans from India: http://www.kiva.org/lend?countries=IN

http://www.kiva.org/updates/kiva/2012/08/15/kiva-launches-in-india.html

teams.name: Sweden
teams.description: Sometimes it's easier to see that what a difference we each make by looking at what we do together -- And having more people together might even convince others to join and lend as well. Feel free to join up if you're a Kiva member in Sweden!

teams.name: Give Green - Environmental Loans
teams.loan_because: We want the world to be a better place.
teams.description:
Made of individual kiva lenders who are concerned about the environmental impacts of their loans. This is a forum to notify each other of environmentally sustainable loans that are needing funding. Sustainable development projects include recycling, solar, re-use, organic agriculture, health, etc. 

We support enterprises that care about the earth and all of its inhabitants. We have no religious, racial or political affiliations of any kind. We want to encourage sustainable enterprises that recycle, reuse, repurpose and use environmentally sound agricultural and manufacturing practices. 
Many of us would like Kiva to develop environmental standards or criteria for their lending practices to prevent environmental impacts that would increase poverty for future generations.
Many people want to have a green portfolio, or at least a green component. 
Won't you join us in creating true sustainability that includes a healthy environment?
